title: Tangerine Cherry Cranberry Sauce
description: Impress your friends and family with Chef John's twist on homemade cranberry sauce. This version--with fresh cranberries, dried cherries, whole spices, and tangerine juice--is sure to delight!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces Cranberry Sauce Recipes Tangerine Cherry Cranberry Sauce 4.8 (84) 67 Reviews 19 Photos Homemade cranberry sauce is very easy and, as long as you sell it properly, your true motives (maximum love for minimum effort) will be our secret. By sell it, I mean tell all about your secret tangerine/cherry-spiked version sauce, and how involved it is to make. Of course, since it is a top-secret recipe, you'll not be able to give details, but you're sure they'll be blown away. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on October 28, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 12 Yield: 12 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 (12 ounce) bag fresh cranberries 1 cup dried cherries 1 cup white sugar 1 cup tangerine juice 1 tablespoon tangerine zest 1 whole star anise 1 cinnamon stick 3 whole cloves Directions Combine cranberries, cherries, sugar, tangerine juice, tangerine zest, star anise, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries are all popped, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Discard star anise, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves, and refrigerate until needed. Chef John I Made It Print 162 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Tangerine Cherry Cranberry Sauce 01 of 19 Photo by  Susan 02 of 19 Photo by  Susan 11/23/2022 This cranberry sauce has been a family favorite for years! I've finally decided to forego the whole cloves in favor of ground ones, just to avoid the time and mild frustration of digging around to fish out the whole cloves. 03 of 19 Photo by  Dawn 11/25/2020 04 of 19 Photo by  Grumpy 11/25/2020 My son say’s it’s the best cranberry sauce ever and insists I make it every year! 05 of 19 Photo by  Grumpy 11/25/2020 My son say’s it’s the best cranberry sauce ever and insists I make it every year! 06 of 19 Photo by  Veronica Brown 11/24/2020 07 of 19 Photo by  jeni 11/28/2019 08 of 19 Photo by  James Gobee 11/22/2018 09 of 19 Photo by  Isis Charise 11/22/2018 I just made three completely different cranberry sauces... this one won hands down and will surely be the one on the thanksgiving table this year!! 10 of 19 Photo by  Diane 11/21/2018 1 2 Next Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: John Mitzewich
instructions: Combine cranberries, cherries, sugar, tangerine juice, tangerine zest, star anise, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries are all popped, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Discard star anise, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves, and refrigerate until needed. Chef John
